{@note Made by Gem}

item.name: Black Candle
entries: {@i This black wax candle burns with a faint, shadowy flame that sheds no light. The wax never diminishes, and the cold iron chamberstick that holds it is perpetually cool to the touch.}

While you are attuned to the Black Candle and are holding it, the candle automatically ignites and remains lit. It continues to burn for up to 8 hours when not held, upon which the flame extinguishes. While the candle is lit, you are immune to the effects of any curses affecting you. This does not prevent you from being cursed—any curses you gain while the candle is lit take effect once the flame is extinguished.

In addition, while holding the lit candle, you can end your attunement to a cursed magic item at will, as long as it can be ended by a {@spell Remove Curse|XPHB} spell. This property does not remove the curse itself, nor does it end any other magical effects of the cursed item.
{@note Based on The Binding of Isaac: Repentance. Made by Miel}

item.name: Bone Heart
entries: {@i A fragile vessel for health, a bony cage that increases vitality while it remains intact.}

entries.name: Fragile Vitality.
entries: When you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you gain 5 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}. When your {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} are reduced to 0 due to taking damage, you may negate any additional damage dealt to your {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, upon which the Bone Heart crumbles and is consumed.
{@note Based on The Binding of Isaac: Repentance. Made by Miel}

item.name: Environment Emulator
entries: {@i Originally designed by a group of kobold tinkerers, this device has seen widespread use for its simulation ability. Many report that it is the most practical way to get hands-on training in any environment, often used for exercise, spars, and military training. Some have attempted to use it as a home, but its illusionary nature and bad upkeep time results in this being impractical.}

It takes 8 hours to enable an Environment Emulator. While enabled, the emulator is immovable and indiscernible. A creature can spend 10 minutes to disable it. If {@spell Dispel Magic|XPHB} is cast on it, it also disables.

While enabled, a creature can spend 1 minute to cast {@spell Mirage Arcane|XPHB} centered on the emulator. When cast in this way, it can only cover a 200 foot square and the spell has a duration of 10 minutes. The emulator glows blue if a creature within the illusion is using {@sense Truesight} to see through it.
{@note Made by Gem}

item.name: Dryad's Sandals
entries: You can move through {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB} composed of vegetation, such as foliage and thorns, without it costing extra movement.

Additionally once per turn while wearing these boots, you can walk into any inanimate plant of a size category larger than you, and immediately exit out of another plant of that size or larger within 60 ft of yourself by using 5 feet of movement.
{@note Taken (accidentally) from Pathfinder, Made by Gem}

item.name: Inquisitor's Notebook
entries: While holding this notebook, you can cast {@spell Legend Lore|XPHB} from it. To cast the spell in this way, you must choose a creature that you can see within 10 feet of you. The information about that creature, provided it is of legendary importance, appears written in the pages of the notebook.
Once used, the notebook cannot use that creature again for 1 year.
{@note Variant of Lorekeeper's Tome by Aris. Made by Landon}

item.name: Nos Erac Ekat
entries: A paintbrush fashioned from a crooked bone, with frayed brushhairs grasping out like fingers. It fits in your hand perfectly.

entries.name: Vivid Paints.
entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with your {@item Psychic Blade|XPHB|Psychic Blades}.

entries.name: Violet Bloom.
entries: You have a mental palette of red and blue that you can splash across your masterworks. Whenever you manifest a {@item Psychic Blade|XPHB|Psychic Blades}, you can change its damage type to Cold or Fire damage.

entries.name: Vantablack.
entries: While holding Nos Erac Ekat, you can cast {@spell Creation|XPHB}, as you paint the object from pure black. Once used, this item can't be used again in this way until the next dawn.
{@note Made by Christopher}

item.name: Megaton
item.reqAttune: by a Path of the Giant Barbarian
entries: A maul of colossal proportion, like an entire planet held aloft by a metal rod. Its rectangular hammerhead is segmented by lines of thrumming energy, indicating the advanced technology lurking within it.

entries.name: Colossus Circuit.
entries: Whenever you enter your Rage, if your size increases from either your Giant's Havoc or Demiurgic Colossus feature, this weapon increases in size alongside you and gains the following benefits for the duration of the Rage:

items: {@b Weight of the World.} When you hit a creature with an attack using this weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@dice 1d6} damage of the same type as its normal damage. This extra damage is increased to {@dice 2d6} if the hit creature is smaller than you.

{@b Atom Smash.} As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can attempt to deal a skull-shattering blow. Make a melee weapon attack using Megaton against a creature that is smaller than you within range. On a hit, they suffer the normal effects of the attack and additionally must make a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 + your Strength modifier + your Proficiency Bonus). On a fail, it is {@condition Slowed|WM4} until the end of your next turn. Once used, this item can't be used again in this way until the next dawn.

entries: {@note Made by Christopher}

item.name: Potion of Poison Immunity
entries: When you drink this potion, you have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to Poison damage and the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition for 1 hour.
This potion looks like a golden-hued liquid, and glows faintly in darkness.
{@note Made by Gavin}

item.name: Ring of Mystery Keys
entries: This key ring always has many {@item Mystery Key|XDMG|Mystery Keys} on it. Inserting a key from the key ring into a lock has a 5 percent chance of unlocking it. If the first inserted key doesn't unlock the lock, none of the keys on the ring can. Once the key ring has unlocked a lock, it cannot unlock another lock for {@dice 1d4} hours.
{@note Made by Gem}

item.name: Tobor
entries: This {@item Chest of Preserving|WDMM} has been outfitted with wheels and magic-induced locomotion, allowing it to act as a delivery unit for whatever it contains.

As a {@action Magic|XPHB} Action while within 15 feet of it, you can verbally command it to travel to a location you are familiar with or to stop traveling (if it is already en route). The location must be within 1 mile of its current location, unmoving, and on the same plane of existence. The target location must be clearly described, and effects that block divination magic block its pathfinding.

It has a movement speed of 15 feet per turn and is blocked by {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}, objects, creatures, and vertical drops. If for some awful reason it enters {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB}, it takes its movement at the end of the round, but does not have a turn of its own (as it is not a creature).
If it cannot find a path to its location after it has begun to travel, it will stop moving and wait until a feasible path exists.
It's unclear why it's called a Tobor.
{@note Made by Christopher}

item.name: Tome of Language Imparted
entries: After reading this scroll, book, or tome (typically takes an hour, but a GM could rule it takes days or even weeks), you are magically imparted a language. You gain that language, and can speak it at a natural level. The language is obscure. It cannot be any of the standard or exotic languages in the phb, nor can it be Druidic or Thieves' Cant.
Once a language has been magically imparted, the tome becomes nonmagical, though it might contain nonmagical lessons in the language.
Examples of adequate languages: Ice Toad, Gnoll, Giant Eagle, Chondathan, Worg...

It is said that the final ingredient of crafting this item is fluency in a language. A creature fluent in a language gives up the language in its entirety, to be passed on to another. The language cannot be learned by that creature again.
{@note Made by Aris}

item.name: Worn Card: 0 - The Fool
entries: {@i 'Where journey begins.'}

As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you may brandish this card to cast {@spell Word of Recall|XPHB} without any components. If you do not have a designated sanctuary, the spell fails and the card is not consumed. Once you use the card, it disintegrates into dust.

item.name: Worn Card: I - The Magician
entries: {@i 'May you never miss your goal.'}
As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action or Bonus Action, you may brandish this card to gain {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on attack rolls for 1 minute. Once you use the card, it disintegrates into dust.

item.name: Worn Card: V - The Hierophant
entries: {@i 'Two prayers for the lost.'}
As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action or Bonus Action, you may brandish this card to gain 10 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}. Once you use the card, it disintegrates into dust.

item.name: Worn Card: VI - The Lovers
entries: {@i 'May you prosper and be in good health.'}

As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action or Bonus Action, you may brandish this card to spend an amount of your {@variantrule Hit Point Die|XPHB} less than or equal to your proficiency bonus. For each {@variantrule Hit Point Die|XPHB} you spend in this way, roll the die and add your Constitution modifier to it. You regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the total (minimum of 1 Hit Point). Once you use the card, it disintegrates into dust.

item.name: Worn Card: VII - The Chariot
entries: {@i 'May nothing stand before you.'}
As an Action or Bonus Action, you may brandish this card to gain the following effects until the end of your next turn:

items: Your movement speed becomes 60 feet.
You cannot cast spells, {@status concentration|XPHB|Concentrate} on spells, or make ranged attacks.
The first melee attack you hit as part of an Attack action deals an extra 1d8 damage of the weapon's damage type.

entries: Once you use the card, it disintegrates into dust.

item.name: Worn Card: V - The Hierophant?
entries: {@i 'Two prayers for the lost.'}

As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action or Bonus Action, you may brandish this card to gain 5 {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}. When these {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} are reduced to 0, you may negate any additional damage dealt to yourself. Once you use the card, it disintegrates into dust.

item.name: ɹǝlɓuoɹɥ⊥ ǝɥ⊥
entries: {@i A coalescence of power beyond this mortal realm, too luck upon this is invite madness upon yourself.}

While attuned to this item, you gain 1 long term madness. When you complete a long rest, you may attempt a DC 15 wisdom saving throw, rerolling on the madness table on a success. Indefinite madness's you gained from this item cannot be removed in any way while you are attuned to this item.

entries.name: ˙uoısıɔxƎ
entries: You can use this item as a focus for your spells, and you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and to the saving throws of your spell DCs while attuned to this item.

entries.name: ˙ɯnʇɐɹʇsqnS (Level 6)
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you may regain all your expended sorcery points. When you regain sorcery points in this way, you gain 1 long term madness. This item can't be used in this way again until the next Dusk.

entries.name: ˙ᴎoiƚɒqiꙅꙅiᗡ (Level 11)
entries: At the start of your turn, while you are {@condition Incapacitated}, you may expend 3 sorcery points to immediately end that condition on yourself and gain 1 random indefinite madness and 1 random long term madness.

entries.name: ˙ʎʇıɹǝΛ (Level 15)
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you may inflict madness on one willing creature you are touching. While this madness lasts, the creature has resistance to psychic damage, and shares the benefits of Revelation in Flesh while it's active and they are within 60 ft of you. Only 1 creature can benefit from this feature at a time, and a creature cannot benefit from this feature more than once a week.

entries.name: ˙ɥʇıuǝZ (Level 19)
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and to the saving throw DCs of your spells instead of a +1. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you may unleash the horrors in a 30 ft {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation}. All creatures (Including you) in the emanation must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your sorcerer spell save DC or suffer 1 short term madness. This item can't be used in this way again until the next Dusk.

entries.name: ˙ǝlɓuoɹɥ⊥(Level 23)
entries: You touch 1 creature and attempt to Throngle them. Make a melee spell attack against a creature within 5 ft of you. On a hit, the creature is {@condition Slowed|WM4} for 1 minute. A {@condition Slowed|WM4} creature may repeat the save at the end of its turn, ending the condition on itself on a success. If a creature fails the save 3 times, it is Throngled for 1 minute. A Throngled creature has every official condition. After you successfully Throngle a creature, your alignment changes randomly, and you gain 3 indefinite madnesses. This item can't be used in this way again until the next Dusk.

entries.name: Legacy Rituals.
entries: These 2 rituals must be completed to unlock s,ɹǝlɓuoɹɥ⊥ ǝɥ⊥ features.

items: {@b Eldritch Truth.} Expose yourself to the horrors of the far realm, without protection or resistance. This unlocks the level 6-15 features.
{@b Gift of Throngling.} Create a new far realm entity and infuse it into a cadaver. This unlocks the level 19-23 features.
